content.question: A <math alttext="60 decimal point milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>60.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of <math alttext="N a O H aqueous " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> was titrated with <math alttext="0.10 molar H C l aqueous " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on the resulting titration curve shown above, what was the approximate concentration of <math alttext="N a O H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in the sample?

skill.text: 5.D: Identify information presented graphically to solve a problem.
